intro: Cyphia couroublei, commonly known as the Madagascar orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its intricate and showy floral structure. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its flowers are often fragrant and display a range of colors, including white, yellow, and pink. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, Cyphia couroublei is considered threatened in its natural habitat.
